summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Parks, Trails, and the Environment Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on December 4, 2023, at 9:00 AM. The meeting will take place in the Council Chambers on the 6th floor of City Hall and will also be accessible via video conference. The primary purpose is to discuss environmental initiatives, park updates, and legislative priorities.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the November 6, 2023, meeting.
2. Presentation of the Comprehensive Environment & Climate Action Plan (CECAP) Annual Report.
3. Update on the economic value of parks.
4. Discussion on the Dallas Environmental Education Initiative (EEI) and an associated interlocal agreement.
5. Remediation update for the Former Blue Star Site.
6. Legislative priorities for the Office of Environmental Quality & Sustainability for 2025.
7. Update from the Environmental Commission.

**Important Details**:  
The CECAP Annual Report will highlight progress on climate initiatives. The Parks Economic Value Update will assess the financial benefits of parks to the community. The EEI interlocal agreement aims to enhance environmental education efforts. Additionally, the remediation of the Former Blue Star Site is crucial for environmental restoration.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and may discuss recommendations based on the updates provided, particularly regarding the interlocal agreement and legislative priorities. The meeting may also include a closed executive session to address legal or property matters as necessary.
